page.topic: Grid Component - Checkbox Column - Custom Ajax Callbacks
page.description: When you do a custom Ajax callback, the 'e' object that is passed into your Xbasic function that handles the callback contains a lot of useful information. Now, the 'e' object contains 3 additional properties that are automatically set if the grid has a checkbox column. The properties are:

case.title: e.checkboxFilter
case.description: a filter command to select all of the checked rows

case.title: e.checkboxFilterArgumentXML
case.description: (for SQL Grids only) if the Grid is based on SQL tables, the e.checkboxFilter property will use arguments (e.g. customerID = :pkValue1). This property contains the XML of the sql::arguments object. This object contains the argument value.

case.title: e.checkboxFilterArgumentsEncoded
case.description: (for SQL Grids only) contains an encoded version of the e.checkboxFilterArgumentXML property that can be used in the .gridFilterSet() method.

Notice that the arguments are encoded into a string that is delimited with '\n' (the Javascript encoded value for a CRLF). The format is:

The encoded arguments are useful if you want to use the .gridFlterSet() method in your callback function. For example, the code below shows how your Xbasic function could compute a Javascript command to return to the browser:
section.example: dim cmd as c cmd = "{grid.object}.gridFilterSet('" +\ e.checkboxFilter + "','','" +\ e.checkboxFilterArgumentsEncoded + ');"
